summary:
I'm a host, a trainer and a poet. I work internationally with organisations and initiatives around social and ecological justice. I help build capacity for authentic leadership, dialogue and collective wise action. I create learning spaces and host the kind of conversations that allow diverse groups of people to move forward together on complex challenges such as climate change and racism. 
My work is rooted in the Art of Hosting Conversations that Matter, Theory U, The Work That Reconnects and complexity theory. 

Together with my team at Bright Future Lab I train students and teachers throughout the Netherlands in sustainability and leadership.

I give (interactive) talks on spiritual ecology, sustainability and education. I write and perform spoken word poetry. A collection of my poetry is published in 'En ze leefde nog' by Uitgeverij Rorschach, Deep Times journal and in MoveMakers on the Move: the Story of Our Learning Journey. 
I am a member of Root to Rise, a collective of women focused on expanding our sense of interbeing in taking care of life on Earth. I am an Associate Fellow Spiritual Ecology of St. Ethelburga's Center for Reconciliation and Peace.

profile_positions.description:
Onderwijs van de toekomst, maar dan vandaag​
Bright Future Lab begon als een droom in een klein stadje genaamd Karlskrona in Zweden, toen ik daar in het jaar 2013 een Master in Strategisch Leiderschap naar Duurzaamheid volgde. Na bijna 21 jaar onderwijs leerde ik in dat ene jaar zo ontzettend veel waardevolle skills en kennis, dat ik deze met zoveel mogelijk mensen wilde delen. Het liefst met alle jongeren van Nederland. Want iedereen is nodig in de transitie naar een duurzame wereld

Wanneer we over duurzaamheid praten, hebben we het over veel meer dan alleen klimaatverandering. ’s Werelds grootste problemen en uitdagingen zijn onlosmakelijk met elkaar verbonden. Van armoede, discriminatie, gender ongelijkheid, percentage depressie en zelfmoord, klimaatverandering, verlies aan biodiversiteit tot aan overconsumptie; alles houdt met elkaar verband.

Sterker nog: de problemen en uitdagingen verergeren en voeden elkaar. Het is tijd om deze negatieve spiraal te doorbreken. Inzicht in duurzaamheid en skills van persoonlijk leiderschap spelen hierbij een essentiële rol. Met Bright Future Lab ontwikkelen we programma's voor MBO, HBO en WO; en trainen we docenten om op een participatieve manier onderwijs te geven, aansluitend bij de complexiteit van de vraagstukken waar we voor staan.

profile_positions.description:
Co-organizer and host for the second edition of Edu on Tour in Brazil. 

Edu on Tour is a visionary initiative of presente! that is active on a global scale in order to support the movement for an education (r)evolution. It is a conscious leadership program with the focus to create high value results while exploring the world’s most inspiring and innovative education initiatives and learning spaces.

With 11 international participants and a team of three on the ground, we mobilized over 500 people when visiting schools, projects and initiatives in the region of São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro over a period of 6 weeks. Organized multiple participatory events, among others at the Impact HUB in São Paulo and Affero Lab in Rio to strengthen and connect local initiatives and learn from each others educational practices and experience. 
 
http://eduontour.weebly.com/

profile_positions.description:
As part of H.H. Dalai Lama's visit to the Netherlands, I co-organized the symposium Education of the Heart on May 12, 2014 at Erasmus University. 

Over 600 change-makers in the field of education joined us for a day of dialogue, reflection and co-creation, with international experts Daniel Siegel and Ian Gilbert. We invited thirteen inspiring examples - schools, projects and programs - to share their vision and practices with the group. H.H. the Dalai Lama spent two hours with us in the afternoon, sharing his views on education of the heart. 

Responsible for selecting and guiding the thirteen inspiring examples that presented on stage, as well as briefing 30 other schools who presented themselves via a poster.

profile_positions.description:
Co-organiser for the ALIA Europe 2014 Leadership Intensive (100 participants internationally, with leading international faculty).
Member of the core team for ALIA Europe 2013-2014.

ALIA (Authentic Leadership in Action) brings together the wisdom, tools, and practices that leaders need to build cultures of sanity and innovation in the midst of great change. ALIA creates powerful incubators for learning and growth. At ALIA programs you will learn how to cultivate and empower everyone’s leadership, including your own.

ALIA is a convener of pioneering leaders and networks who are implementing positive change. It is also a place of applied learning and skill-building in the art and practice of authentic leadership and social innovation.

ALIA recognises that leadership is concentrated in formal positions, but it also exists everywhere. To move forward with confidence and clarity in these shifting times, everyone’s leadership is needed. Through its programs and activities, ALIA strengthens and builds on innate leadership capacities such as mindfulness, systems awareness, creativity, courage, and resilience.

Through leadership programs, Humans of Health offers the upcoming generation in healthcare the opportunity to develop themselves and to cultivate a sustainable change that is rooted in deep intrinsic motivation. Our times of globalisation and visible interconnectedness offer us a way of connection across generations and across cultures. Through this platform, a conducive environment is offered to those working on transformation in healthcare. The platform welcomes all those who want to initiate a positive change and who envision a future that is bright to a community of travellers looking for answers in healthcare. We strive to activate, connect, create, collaborate and inspire for a healthcare system that truly supports health in a self-sustaining way.
